title: Low & Slow Brocco Rabe
ingredients: ½cup pickled Peppadew peppers, plus 1 tablespoon brine from the jar
½cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
directions: 1. Prep the ingredients:- Trim off 1 inch from the stems of 2 bunches of broccoli rabe. Cut it crosswise into 2-inch pieces.- Chop ½ cup pickled Peppadew peppers.- Thinly slice 8 garlic cloves.

2. Start cooking:- Heat ½ cup olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat.- Add the sliced garlic cloves and cook, stirring often, until fragrant and just starting to turn light golden brown, about 3 minutes.- Add the broccoli rabe, chopped Peppadews, 1 tablespoon Peppadew brine, 1 (14-ounce) can tomato puree, ¾ teaspoon red pepper flakes, and 1½ teaspoons salt. Toss to combine and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 35 to 45 minutes until the broccoli rabe is very tender.- Uncover, increase the heat to medium-high, and continue to cook until the sauce thickens and very little liquid remains, about 5 minutes. Stir in about 1 ounce grated Parmesan cheese. Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt if needed.
3. Serve:- Transfer the broccoli rabe to a serving dish. Drizzle with more olive oil and top with an additional 1 ounce of grated Parmesan.
